title: Sri Lanka finance minister to present Rs 695mn supplementary estimate on June 08
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in his capacity as Finance Minister will present a supplementary estimate of 695 billion rupees to parliament next Wednesday (08), preceded by a special statement on Tuesday (07) on the state of the economy.

Main opposition Samagi Jana Balavegaya (SJB) MP Mano Ganesan told reporters after a party leaders’ meeting held in parliament on Thursday (02) that approval will be sought for essential expenditures incurred outside the budget so far.
“A supplementary estimate will be presented for such expenditure going forward, which the Prime Minister will do in his capacity as Finance Minister,” said Ganesan.
A two-day debate will also be held following the presentation, he said. (Colombo/Jun02/2022)
